column2: ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
Reference Documents: MTM Track Drainage L1-CHE-STD-030 (July 2018)
Precast steel reinforced concrete drainage pits shall be manufactured, supplied and installed in accordance with 705.07.
Step irons shall be manufactured by 13mm steel bar covered with polypropylene plastic in accordance with 705.04
Precast reinforced concrete pipes shall be manufactured, supplied and installed in accordance with 701.05.
Flexible pipes shall be supplied in accordance with 701.07
Subsurface drainage shall be supplied in accordance with 702.04
Bedding Material shall be free from perishable matter, lumps and conform with the requirements of Table 701.091 and Table 701.092.
Ordinary and Selected Backfill Material shall be free from perishable matter, lumps and conform with the requirements of Table 701.091 and Table 701.092.
Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate the plan location, height and line of pits and location, invert level, plan of pipes in accordance with design documentation and 701.10
ATTACH: LOT MARKED UP LOCATION ON THE IFC DRAWING (LOT MAP):
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavation shall be to the depth indicated on the design documentation. Precast pits must have a clearance of 400mm from excavation face and external face of pit.
Bedding conforming to to 710.09 shallbe supplied, placed and compacted to a thickness:
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Plan location of pits, other than offsets to kerb line or barriers, to be +/- 100mm
All connections shall be finished to provide a smooth surface, uniform with the inner of the pit structure. Saw cut surrounding hole shall not exceed 50mm greater than the pipe diameter.
Exposed reinforcement shall be coated with an approved epoxy treatment
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pit floors are smoothly shaped from inlet to outlet for a height one third the diameter of the outlet pipe.
Drainage pits greater than 1.0m deep shall be fitted with step irons in accordance with 705.12. Ladder rungs shall not opbstruct openings and that water does not discharge on them.
Step rungs do not come within 50mm of the top of the riser
Frames for drainage pit covers shall be cast in place or or bedded on fresh mortar, 5mm thick, consisting of 2 parts sand and 1 part cement.
Height shall be within 10mm of the design level
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All stormwater pits shall be provided with a locakable minimum Class D piit lid, grate or ballast cage in accordance with MTM L1-CHE-STD-030
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfilling around drainage pits shall be placed in layers not exceeding 300mm loose thickness and compacted to refusal
Excavation for pipe shall have a horizontal clearance between the pipe and the excavation wall of:
The base of the trench shall be compacted to refusal using mechanical plant.
Bedding material shall be provided and placed in the full width of the trench to the below minimum:
Bedding material shall be placed and compacted in layers <150mm loose thickness
Rebate and socket ends of pipe segments shall be placed facing upstream and be fully entered.
Gaps between spigot and socket are in accordance with the manufacturers specifications
The lower portion of the pipe shall be in contact with the bedding layer and shaped to accomodate the joint collar along its full length
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All buried flexible pipe sections supplied shall be assembled in accordance with the manufacturers specifications
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Lifting holes shall be plugged off in accordance with the manufacturers specifications after the pipe is installed.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Location of drainage shall be verified by a surveyor prior to backfilling
Backfill material shall be placed the full width of the bedding material and compacted in layers <150mm loose thickness.
Filling shall not be placed within 2.0m of the open end of the pipe.
Test a minimum of 20% of all lots for each culvert. (Lot = 1 layer of bedding or backfill)

Backfill material shall be compacted to a density ratio > 97%. Material which has a swell equal or greater than 2.5% shall be maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of overlaying layer
Excavation for pipe shall have a horizontal clearance between the pipe and the excavation wall of > 150mm for Flexible Pipe
The base of the trench shall be compacted to refusal using mechanical plant and be <50mm below the specified level of the invert
Trench to be wrapped with geotextile in accordance with the manufacturers specifications.
All laps are to have 150mm lapped at the top of the trench
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding of granular filter material of thickness between 25 mm and 50mm placed across bottom of trench and screeded or graded to level
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipe shall be placed centrally in the trench on the prepared bedding. Slotted pipes shall be laid with the opening in the lower half of the  pipe.
Material shall be placed moist and compacted in layers not exceeding 300mm.
The method of compaction shall be in accordance with the procedures and reviewed by the NA.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All subsurface drainage shall have no fines concrete filter medium. No-fines concrete placed and compacted within 1 hour of mixing
All pipes shall be flushed clean from end to end on completion
All drainage lines shall be inspected after completion of earthworks to subgrade level and prior to construction of the pavement layer by an independent testing organisation using CCTV
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Provide record of dimensional measurements to demonstrate the drainage is within the tolerances specified in 701.10
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Attach Survey Conformance Report
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed in Teambinder
FREQUENCY: Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area
Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance Final Inspection

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
